availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Elkton, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married Amanda Harrison. Father of Kelly J. Harrison, Laura Harrison, Eugene Harrison, Sarah Harrison, and Robert Harrison. Admitted to the bar in 1838. Attorney in Elkton in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in 1850 and nineteen in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 1; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 4, p. 5; H. Charles Ulman, Lawyersâ€™ Record and Official Register of the United States (New York: A. S. Barnes and Co., 1972), p. 538.
